review:
Listen up, comrades! AcadLayer comes to the table with a vision: to break the chains of centralized education and put power back in the hands of learners and builders. They promise ZK-Rollups for scalability, privacy-preserving credentials, modular APIs, and DAO governance. But do they deliver on the hard evidence and measurable impact our movement demands?

First, the strengths. AcadLayer’s use of ZK-Rollups and ZK Talent Proofs is a bold step toward privacy and scalability—two pillars of a truly decentralized future. Their modular APIs and SDKs could lower the barriers for EdTech to join the Ethereum revolution. The roadmap is clear, with funds allocated to development, audits, and community engagement. They even have a testnet live, showing some boots-on-the-ground progress.

But let’s not be blinded by big promises. The application is heavy on vision, light on hard data. Where are the user numbers, adoption metrics, or evidence of real-world traction? The claim of 90% gas reduction is impressive, but where’s the proof? And while they talk about open-source values, there’s no direct evidence of community contributions or governance in action. The project is built as an Avalanche subnet, yet this is an Ethereum infrastructure round—how much of their core work truly strengthens Ethereum, not just their own ecosystem?

AcadLayer’s commitment to privacy, interoperability, and user experience is commendable. But comrades, we must demand more than words. We need transparent reporting, open governance, and clear, measurable outcomes. Only then can we ensure this project serves the many, not the few.

In the spirit of collective progress, I call for changes before full support. Let’s see the data. Let’s see the community. Let’s see the impact!

strengths.title: Innovative Use of ZK-Rollups and ZK Talent Proofs
strengths.description: AcadLayer leverages advanced cryptography to address scalability and privacy, aligning with the Ethereum community’s push for secure, efficient, and private infrastructure.

strengths.title: Modular APIs and SDKs for Ecosystem Growth
strengths.description: The project offers tools that could enable other developers and institutions to build on Ethereum, fostering broader adoption and interoperability.

strengths.title: Clear Roadmap and Fund Allocation
strengths.description: The application outlines a structured development plan with specific phases and budget allocations, demonstrating a planned approach to resource use.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Evidence
weaknesses.description: The application lacks concrete data on user adoption, transaction volumes, or real-world impact. Claims of gas reduction and throughput are not substantiated with verifiable metrics.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Open-Source and Community Governance Evidence
weaknesses.description: While open-source and DAO governance are mentioned, there is no direct evidence of active community participation, open development, or transparent decision-making.

weaknesses.title: Ambiguous Contribution to Ethereum vs. Avalanche
weaknesses.description: AcadLayer is built as an Avalanche subnet, raising questions about how much of its core infrastructure directly benefits Ethereum, as required by the round’s eligibility.

changes.title: Provide Verifiable Metrics and Impact Data
changes.description: Submit clear, quantitative evidence of user adoption, transaction throughput, and gas savings. Include links to dashboards, analytics, or case studies demonstrating real-world impact.

changes.title: Demonstrate Open-Source Activity and Community Governance
changes.description: Show active open-source development (e.g., GitHub contributions, issue tracking) and evidence of DAO governance in action (e.g., proposals, votes, community discussions).

changes.title: Clarify Direct Contribution to Ethereum Infrastructure
changes.description: Detail how the project’s core components (ZK-Rollups, APIs, credentialing) are deployed on or integrated with Ethereum, not just Avalanche. Provide technical documentation or deployment records.
